summary: Create a professional personal resume website to showcase experience, skills, and contact information.
architectural_notes: Hero/Intro: render the greeting headline as one line; style the "Hi, I'm" text in black (explicit color override if needed to match theme).
Hero/Intro headline: render "Hi, I'm..." as the first line in black text; render the name "Fatima Chowdhury" on a second line below.
known_issues: Footer still displays the text "using caffeine.ai" despite attempted removal; user reports the change did not take effect.
Deployment/build failed during deployment; website is not running.

Hero/Intro section layout is not centered in the middle of the page as requested (should match the centering of the "About Me" section), and the greeting text "Hi, I'm ..." is not displayed as desired.
Custom domain setup not applied: site still shows/uses the caffeine.xyz draft URL instead of fatimachowdhury.com.
User reports the website is not opening/accessible right now.

existing_features.title: Create a responsive, professional resume website with core sections: Hero/Intro, About, Experience, Education, Skills, Projects/Portfolio, and Contact.
Implement a clean navigation experience: a top navigation bar with anchor links to each section and a prominent call-to-action button (e.g., “Download Resume” or “Contact”).

Provide a structured data model on the frontend (TypeScript objects) for resume content (name, headline, summary, experience entries, education entries, skills, project entries, contact links) so the site can be updated by editing a single file.
Add a Contact section that supports copy-to-clipboard for email and displays external links (e.g., LinkedIn, GitHub) with clear labels; do not require sending emails.

Apply a coherent, distinctive visual theme suitable for a professional resume site (typography, spacing, color palette, section styling) and enforce it consistently across all sections (avoid blue & purple).

Add static assets for branding and identity: a favicon, a simple personal logo/monogram, and a hero headshot illustration or silhouette, and render them in the UI from frontend/public/assets/generated.

Extract resume details from the uploaded screenshot (Screenshot 2026-02-05 150324.png) and update the site’s content data model in frontend/src/resumeData.ts to match the resume, replacing the current placeholder person and entries.
Add support for a phone number in the resume data model and render it in the UI alongside existing contact information.

Ensure sections gracefully handle missing/empty resume fields that are not present in the uploaded resume (e.g., projects and social links) by conditionally hiding empty sections/blocks and avoiding empty layouts.

Update the footer content so the attribution text/link "using caffeine.ai" is removed from the footer’s inner container element (/html[1]/body[1]/div[1]/div[1]/footer[1]/div[1]) while keeping the rest of the site unchanged.

Update the footer inner container content (the element at XPath /html[1]/body[1]/div[1]/div[1]/footer[1]/div[1]) to remove the attribution text/link "using caffeine.ai" while keeping the rest of the site unchanged.

Make the Footer component self-contained by removing the lucide-react Heart icon import/usage and replacing it with simple inline markup so the frontend build cannot fail due to a missing icon dependency, without adding any new attribution text.

Remove the selected image element at XPath /html[1]/body[1]/div[1]/div[1]/main[1]/section[1]/div[2]/div[1]/div[2]/div[1]/img[1] (the hero headshot in the Hero section) so it is no longer rendered in the DOM, while leaving all other Hero section content unchanged.

Update only the Hero section text-content container at XPath /html[1]/body[1]/div[1]/div[1]/main[1]/section[1]/div[2]/div[1]/div[1] so the content is centered at the top of the page and arranged in this vertical order: (1) the user’s name as a single full-line sentence, (2) a second centered line that reads "Computer Science", (3) the "Get in Touch" and "Learn More" buttons directly below that second line.

Update the Hero/Intro section layout so its text content is centered in the middle of the page (visually centered like the “About Me” section), and ensure the Hero headline explicitly includes the greeting text “Hi, I’m …” (e.g., “Hi, I’m {resumeData.name}”) while keeping the rest of the Hero content ("Computer Science" line and the “Get in Touch” / “Learn More” buttons) present and centered below the headline.

Update ONLY the Hero headline span at XPath /html[1]/body[1]/div[1]/div[1]/main[1]/section[1]/div[2]/div[1]/h1[1]/span[1] so the greeting renders as a single unbroken line and the substring "Hi, I'm" is styled in black text while keeping the name immediately following it on the same line.

Update ONLY the element at XPath /html[1]/body[1]/div[1]/div[1]/main[1]/section[5]/div[2]/div[1] (the Skills section content grid container) to render two side-by-side columns where the left column contains the first 4 skill-category blocks and the right column contains the remaining 3 skill-category blocks, while keeping the existing visual styling of each skill-category block unchanged.

Update the Skills section UI so the single skill category "Technical & Professional Skills" no longer renders as one large card containing all 7 skill pills; instead render two separate white cards side-by-side (on md+ screens) where the left card contains exactly these 4 items in this order: "Microsoft Excel & Spreadsheets", "Microsoft Office Suite", "Basic SQL (coursework exposure)", "Data organization and accuracy"; and the right card contains the remaining 3 skill items ("Problem solving & critical thinking", "Teamwork and communication", "Computer proficiency") using the same pill styling currently used for each skill.

Update the single-category SkillsSection layout (the special case when there is exactly 1 skill category with >4 skills) so it renders as ONE large rectangular card/container, with the text "Technical & Professional Skills" centered in the middle of that rectangle, and with the skill pills split into TWO subsections at the bottom of the same rectangle (left subsection contains the 4 specified skills in order; right subsection contains the remaining skills).

Update ONLY the Hero section content container at XPath /html[1]/body[1]/div[1]/div[1]/main[1]/section[1]/div[2]/div[1] so the headline renders on two lines: the first line reads exactly "Hi, I'm..." and is styled in black text, and the second line reads exactly "Fatima Chowdhury".
Configure the deployed resume website to use the custom domain fatimachowdhury.com (set up and point the domain so fatimachowdhury.com serves the live site).

Update the frontend so that when the site is opened on the Caffeine draft domain (e.g., funny-pink-4yi-draft.caffeine.xyz), it automatically redirects to https://fatimachowdhury.com/ and removes the #caffeineAdminToken=... fragment from the URL during the redirect.

Verify and fix the deployment/custom-domain configuration so that fatimachowdhury.com serves the live resume site directly (not only via a redirect), and visiting fatimachowdhury.com shows the same content as the current draft deployment.
Restore site availability so the resume website successfully loads in the browser (no blank page / unreachable deployment) and the deployment completes without errors.

Update the domain-redirect logic in frontend/index.html so it does not make the site inaccessible when the custom domain fatimachowdhury.com is not yet reachable/configured (avoid hard-failing access by redirecting users away from a working draft URL).

Update the redirect logic in frontend/index.html so that opening the site on the Caffeine draft domain (e.g., https://funny-pink-4yi-draft.caffeine.xyz/) reliably redirects to https://fatimachowdhury.com/ whenever the canonical domain is reachable, even if a previous reachability check in the same browser tab/session had cached the canonical domain as unreachable.

new_feature_requests.summary: Build a professional resume website to present experience, skills, and contact information.
Populate the website content from the user’s provided resume (enter/transfer resume details into the site’s data model).
Remove the entire footer element/content from the resume website (user requested to remove "this whole thing" in context of footer).

Center the Hero/Intro content at the top of the page: show the user’s name on one line, “Computer Science” on the next centered line, and place the “Get in touch” and “Learn more” buttons below the headline text.
Update the Hero/Intro section so it is centered in the middle of the page like the "About Me" section, and ensure the greeting text "Hi, I'm ..." remains visible in the Hero.
Update the Hero headline so the greeting text "Hi, I'm ..." appears as a single line of text, and ensure the "Hi, I'm" portion is styled in black.
Divide the relevant content into two side-by-side sections/columns, with 4 points on one side and 3 points on the other.

Update ONLY the element at XPath /html[1]/body[1]/div[1]/div[1]/main[1]/section[5]/div[2]/div[1]/div[1]/div[1] so the content is divided into two side-by-side sections/columns, with the first 4 points/items rendered in the left column and the remaining 3 points/items rendered in the right column, while keeping the existing visual styling of each item unchanged.

Update the Skills section to render two separate white squares/cards (two columns): left card contains these 4 items (Microsoft Excel & Spreadsheets; Microsoft Office Suite; Basic SQL (coursework exposure); Data organization and accuracy) and the remaining 3 skill items appear in the right card, instead of one large square containing all 7 items.

Revise the Skills section layout to be one large rectangle/card with the text "Technical & Professional Skills" centered in the middle, and the two skill item sections rendered at the bottom (two subsections/columns) within the same rectangle.
Update the Hero/Intro headline layout so the first line reads "Hi, I'm..." in black text, and the second line shows the name "Fatima Chowdhury".
Configure and point the website to the custom domain fatimachowdhury.com (custom domain setup).
